Does the policy have a waiting period fo: Coverage is not available for pre-existing diseases, time-bound exclusions, and waiting periods.
What does the policy define as a reasona: REASONABLE AND CUSTOMARY CHARGES means the charges for services or supplies, which are the standard charges for the specific provider and consistent with the prevailing charges in the area.

What are the age eligibility criteria fo: Dependent Children (i.e. natural or legally adopted) between the ages 91 days to 18 years are covered. However, male children can be covered up to age 25 if they are bonafide regular students.

Are there any exclusions related to mate: 2.32 NEW BORN BABY means baby born during the Policy Period and is cover from day 1.
Are cosmetic or plastic surgeries covere: It covers Ophthalmic ailments arising out of trauma/ infection/ age related diseases/ foreign body removals and excludes cosmetic eye surgeries, Lasik, cost of spectacles and contact lenses.
Is outpatient (OPD) treatment covered un: 2.37 OUT-PATIENT TREATMENT is one in which the Insured visits a clinic/Hospital or associated health care provider for consultation or treatment.
Are dental treatments covered under the: 2.11 DENTAL TREATMENT means a treatment related to teeth or structures supporting teeth.
Are maternity-related expenses covered u: Maternity expenses means expenses towards lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the Policy Period. Is organ donor surgery covered, includin: Pre and Post Hospitalisation expenses are covered.  The policy also mentions coverage for surgical procedures.

Deductible means a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the policyholder/insured will bear a specified amount of the admissible claim before the insurer starts paying.
Are congenital or genetic disorders incl: Congenital Anomaly refers to a condition(s) which is present since birth, and which is covered under the policy is conditional upon.  Internal and external congenital anomalies are specified.

Does the policy offer a no-claim bonus o: The policy mentions a cumulative bonus and waiver of waiting periods for those who maintain their policy without a break.  However, the specific details of a no-claim bonus or cumulative discount are not provided.
Does the policy exclude treatment for in: Mental conditions associated with alcohol and drug abuse are excluded.  Treatment for alcohol, drug, or substance abuse, and its consequences, is also excluded.
Is HIV/AIDS treatment covered or exclude: The company will cover medical expenses for in-patient care and pre- and post-hospitalization expenses related to HIV infection.
Does the policy exclude coverage for war: Treatment is excluded for injuries caused by war (declared or not), war-like occurrences, invasion, acts of foreign enemies, hostilities, civil war, rebellion, revolution, insurrection, mutiny, military or usurped power, seizure, capture, arrest, restraint, and detention.
Does the policy offer a second medical o: The policy covers medical expert’s fees for a medical second opinion if the insured person is diagnosed with one of the specified major illnesses, taken either before or during treatment, provided the hospitalization claim is admissible. What are the exclusions under the person: The company shall not be liable under the personal accident section for injuries/death due to intentional self-injury, suicide or attempted suicide, being under the influence of intoxicating liquor, engagement in aviation or ballooning, speed contests or racing (other than on foot), bungee jumping, parasailing, parachuting, ski-diving, base jumping, paragliding, hang gliding, mountain or rock climbing necessitating the use of guides or ropes, solo climbing, ice climbing, ice canoeing, scuba diving, caving, cave diving, potholing, abseiling, snowboarding, wave ski surfing, deep sea diving using hard helmet and breathing apparatus, polo, snow and ice sports, similar hazardous activities, military, air force or naval operations, or whilst mounting into, dismounting from or travelling in any aircraft other than specified.
Is there any benefit under the policy if: Yes, under the Platinum Plan, if an insured person suffers an Accident during the policy period that is the sole and direct cause of total permanent disability within 365 days from the date of the accident, the policy will pay a fixed amount of 10% of the base sum insured. This benefit is not applicable for dependent children.
Does the policy include any benefit for: Yes, the policy includes Air Ambulance Cover, available for the Platinum Plan only, which covers air ambulance cost up to 5% of the policy sum insured for life-threatening medical emergencies requiring immediate and rapid ambulance transportation to a hospital/medical center that ground transportation cannot provide. This is provided necessary medical treatment is not available at the insured person's location, it is prescribed by a medical practitioner, and is medically necessary, with the insured person being in India.
What are the implications of getting adm: Claim in respect of Cashless Access Services will be through the Company / TPA provided admission is in a network Hospital/ Nursing Home and is subject to pre admission authorization. All documents must be duly attested by the Insured Person/Claimant for claim submission.
Which illnesses are eligible for the sec: If the Insured Person is diagnosed with one of the specified major Illnesses, the policy covers Medical Expert’s fees for a Medical Second Opinion. Is there any restoration of sum insured: Yes, if during the Policy Period the Sum Insured gets reduced or exhausted on account of a claim under the Policy, the Sum Insured is automatically restored to the extent of the claim amount but not exceeding the Restoration limit opted (50% / 100% of Sum Insured) at the inception of the Policy. This benefit is available only under Silver and Gold Plans.
Does the policy offer personal accident: Yes, Personal Accident coverage can be taken as an optional cover on payment of additional premium, and co-payment will not apply on this cover.
Can the policy be extended for internati: Yes, the Policy can be extended to cover Insured Persons visiting other SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Co-operation) countries - Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka. No additional premium will be charged for this extension, but the Insured Person must make a written request before leaving the country.
Does the policy cover outpatient consult: Treatment that can be and is usually taken on an Out-Patient basis is not covered; however, Pre-Hospitalization Medical Expenses for consultations, investigations, and medicines incurred up to 60 days before admission and Post-Hospitalization Medical Expenses incurred up to 90 days after discharge are covered for Inpatient, Day Care, or Domiciliary treatment.
What is the waiting period for pre-exist: Expenses related to the treatment of a pre-existing disease (PED) and its direct complications shall be excluded until the expiry of 36 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy with insurer. In case of non-disclosure, an additional waiting period of not exceeding 4 years may be incorporated from the date the non-disclosed condition was detected. If any specified disease/procedure falls under another waiting period, the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply.
What is the procedure to raise a claim f: For planned hospitalization, notification must be given at least 48 hours prior to admission. For emergency hospitalization, notify within 24 hours of the start of hospitalization. For cashless service at a Network Hospital, notify at least 48 hours before planned treatment or within 24 hours after emergency treatment. Supporting documentation, medical records, and information must be provided within 15 days of the earlier of the request or discharge/completion of treatment, including a completed claim form, original bills, reports, diagnosis, and a detailed list of services.
Who can be covered under this family flo: The Happy Family Floater Policy can cover a newly wed spouse within 90 days of marriage or at the time of renewal, and a newborn child from day one of birth or at the time of renewal. Additionally, persons above the age of 70 years can be covered under the Silver or Gold Plan.
Is there a daily hospital cash allowance: Yes, a Daily Hospital Cash Allowance is available, payable at 0.1% of the Sum Insured per day of Hospitalization, subject to a maximum compensation for 10 days per illness, with an overall liability limited to 1.5% of the Sum Insured during the Policy Period.
Is outpatient treatment for dental or ey: Expenses incurred on Out Patient Department (OPD) are generally excluded, except for OPD benefit for Dental and Ophthalmic cover in the Platinum Plan.
How long must the policy be active befor: Maternity benefits are applicable only in the Diamond and Platinum Plan, provided the plan has been continuously in force for a period of minimum 24 months in respect of both the Insured and his/her spouse.
Is ART (Assisted Reproduction Treatment): Assisted Reproduction Treatment (ART) is covered under the Platinum plan for sub-fertility/infertility where it is proven by a specialized doctor that conception through natural process is not possible. This treatment involves in-vitro handling of human oocytes and sperm or embryos for establishing a pregnancy.
What are the conditions under which the: The policy covers in-patient hospitalization medical expenses in respect of the organ donor when the Insured Person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (amended) and other applicable regulations. The organ must be for the use of the Insured Person advised to undergo transplant, and the Insured Person's claim must be admissible under the Hospitalization section. Exclusions include costs associated with organ acquisition, donor screening, and any pre and post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor.
Is a separate benefit available if the i: Yes, a lump sum payment of 10% of the Sum Insured is payable to the Insured Person donating an organ, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (amended) and other applicable regulations.
What percentage of expenses will the ins: Under the SILVER plan, the insured has to bear 10% of the admissible claim Amount in each and every claim.
Is there any benefit or waiver available: Yes, a Waiver of Proportionate Deduction Clause is available by paying an additional premium. This waiver means that proportionate deductions related to the room rent category will not be applied, and all related expenses will be payable as per the entitled room category.
What are the exclusions under domiciliar: The Company's liability under Domiciliary Hospitalization Benefit is restricted for conditions including Epilepsy, Hypertension, Influenza, Cough and Cold, Pyrexia of unknown origin for less than 10 days, Tonsillitis and Upper Respiratory Tract infection including Laryngitis and Pharyngitis, and Arthritis, Gout and Rheumatism.
Is treatment for dog bites covered, and: Treatment for dog bites (or bites of any other rabid animal like monkey, cat etc.) is covered, with a maximum of Rs. 5,000/- actually incurred on immunization injections in any one Policy Period. This benefit is part of Domiciliary Hospitalization limits.
Are pre-existing diseases covered immedi: No, pre-existing diseases are not covered immediately after the policy starts. Coverage is subject to a waiting period of 36 months from the effective date of the policy and declaration at the time of application and acceptance by the insurer.
Can insured persons claim OPD expenses u: Generally, expenses incurred on Out Patient Department (OPD) are excluded, except for an OPD benefit for Dental and Ophthalmic cover in the Platinum Plan.
What expenses are not covered if the ins: Expenses incurred towards treatment in any hospital or by any Medical Practitioner or any other provider specifically excluded by the Insurer and disclosed on its website/notified to policy holders are not admissible. However, in life-threatening situations or following an accident, expenses up to the stage of stabilization are payable.
Is there any maximum entry age for famil: The maximum entry age for all members under this plan is 65 years. However, a Policy covering any person above the age of 70 years cannot change plans, and persons 70 years of age can be covered under Silver or Gold Plan, but not under Diamond and Platinum Plan, with a co-payment applied in all subsequent renewals.
What is the benefit payable if the insur: Under the Personal Accident Cover, if the Insured Person dies due to an accidental bodily injury within 12 months of its occurrence, the Company undertakes to pay 100% of the Capital Sum Insured (CSI).
Can the policyholder claim telemedicine: Yes, telemedicine consultation charges are allowed in the terms and conditions of the policy contract, subject to limits/sub-limits prescribed in the Policy Schedule and compliance with Telemedicine Practice Guidelines.
What amount is reimbursed for telemedici: The limit of the amount payable for telemedicine consultations is a maximum of Rs. 2,000/- per family, for a policy period.
How is chronic kidney failure defined an: Chronic Kidney disease is defined as End stage renal disease presenting as chronic irreversible failure of both kidneys to function, as a result of which either regular renal dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis) is instituted or renal transplantation is carried out. Diagnosis must be confirmed by a specialist Medical Practitioner.
Are modern treatments like robotic surge: Yes, Robotic surgeries are covered with limits of 10% of Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 1,00,000 or INR 2,00,000 per policy period. Stem cell therapy is covered only for Hematopoietic stem cells for bone marrow transplant for hematological conditions, with limits of 10% of Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000 per policy period.
What are the defined sub-limits for oral: For Oral chemotherapy, the sub-limit is 25% of the Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or up to INR 1,50,000 per policy period. For Immunotherapy (Monoclonal Antibody to be given as injection), the sub-limit is 10% of the Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000 per policy period.
What is covered under the critical illne: The Platinum plan provides a 'Life Hardship Survival Benefit Plan' for any of the 11 critical illnesses defined in the policy. If an Insured Person is diagnosed with one of these illnesses and a claim is admissible, a survival benefit becomes payable.
How many critical illnesses are covered: There are 11 critical illnesses covered for the life hardship survival benefit.
What is the minimum duration of hospital: For inpatient care treatment, the Insured Person has to stay in a Hospital for more than 24 hours. However, a relaxation to 24 hours minimum duration for Hospitalization is allowed for day care procedures/surgeries.
Are ICU expenses, including specialist c: ICU (Intensive Care Unit) charges include expenses for ICU bed, general medical support services, monitoring devices, critical care nursing, and intensivist charges. All related expenses are payable as per the entitled room category based on the Room Rent/ICU limit, and proportionate deductions related to the room rent category can be waived by paying an additional premium.
What is the scope of the cashless treatm: Cashless facility means direct payments by the insurer to the network provider for the costs of treatment undergone by the insured, in accordance with policy terms and conditions, to the extent pre-authorization is approved. This facility is available through network hospitals and is subject to pre-admission authorization based on eligibility verification and provision of relevant medical details.
What are the conditions under which pre-: Coverage for any pre-existing disease is available after the expiry of 36 months, subject to it being declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. Renewal and migration provisions also allow for gaining credit for pre-existing diseases, contributing to continuous coverage.
What is the waiting period for critical: Expenses related to listed conditions, surgeries/treatments are excluded until the expiry of a specified waiting period of continuous coverage. If a specified disease/procedure falls under the waiting period for pre-existing diseases, the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply. There is also a general 30-day waiting period for any illness from the first policy commencement date, except for claims arising due to an accident.
Does the policy offer coverage from day: Yes, the Policy covers a New Born Baby from day one only on payment of requisite premium. Medical expenses incurred for treatment taken in Hospital as an in-patient shall be payable, subject to policy terms and conditions. If a claim is spread over two Policy Periods, the aggregate liability is limited to the Sum Insured of the Policy under which the claim was reported.
How does the co-payment clause apply und: For Insured Persons 70 years of age or older covered under the Silver Plan, co-payment will apply in all subsequent renewals. A waiver of any terms, provisions, conditions, and endorsements of this Policy is not valid unless made in writing and signed by an authorized official of the Company.
Are maternity expenses covered, and what: Medical treatment expenses traceable to childbirth (including complicated deliveries and cesarean sections) and expenses towards miscarriage (unless due to an accident) and lawful medical termination of pregnancy are generally excluded, except for ectopic pregnancy. However, this exclusion does not apply for Diamond and Platinum plans. The company’s maximum liability per delivery or termination is limited to 2.5% of the Sum Insured in any one Policy Period.
Is assisted reproduction treatment (ART): Yes, Assisted Reproduction Treatment (ART) is included and will be reimbursed for sub-fertility/infertility. It must be proven by a specialized doctor that it is not possible to conceive through natural process due to established sub-fertility/infertility problems of the couple.
What is the financial benefit if the ins: A lump sum payment of 10% of the Sum Insured is payable to the Insured Person donating an organ to cover medical and other incidental expenses, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (amended) and any other applicable regulations.
Are expenses related to the organ donor: Yes, the Policy covers in-patient Hospitalization Medical expenses in respect of the organ donor when the Insured Person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994, the organ is for the Insured Person, and the Insured Person's claim is admissible under the Hospitalization section. Excluded costs include organ acquisition, donor screening, and any pre and post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor.
What is the total daily limit and maximu: The daily hospital cash allowance is 0.1% of the Sum Insured per day of Hospitalization, subject to a maximum compensation for 10 days per illness. The overall liability of the Company during the Policy Period will be limited to 1.5% of the Sum Insured.
Are ambulance charges reimbursed, and wh: Ambulance service charges are reimbursed. For other plans (likely Diamond/Platinum), the limit is Rs.2000 maximum per illness and 1% of Sum Insured per policy period, subject to a maximum of Rs.6000.
Can expenses incurred before or after ho: Yes, medical expenses incurred 30 days prior to Hospitalization and up to 60 days post Hospitalization can be claimed as Pre and Post Hospitalization expenses.
Is mental illness covered under any plan: Mental conditions associated with the abuse of alcohol and drugs, mental retardation and associated complications, and psychological counseling or psychotherapy not requiring hospitalization are excluded. Treatment for alcoholic/drug/substance abuse or any addictive condition and its consequences are also excluded.
Does the policy cover modern medical tec: Yes, the policy covers Stem cell therapy for Hematopoietic stem cells for bone marrow transplant for hematological conditions, subject to limits of 10% of SI, up to INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000 per policy period. Other Stem Cell Surgery is excluded. Modern treatment methods like robotics have a sub-limit on associated expenses, indicating coverage over and above the limit for conventional surgery.
Are outpatient dental and ophthalmic exp: Any expenses incurred on Out Patient Department (OPD) are generally excluded, except for an OPD benefit for Dental and Ophthalmic cover in the Platinum Plan. Dental treatment is excluded unless necessitated due to an Injury.
Does the Platinum Plan include coverage: Yes, the Platinum Plan includes coverage for a Life Hardship Survival Benefit Plan. If an Insured Person is diagnosed with any of the 11 critical Illnesses defined in the policy (not specified in the clause) and a claim is admissible, a survival benefit becomes payable. This coverage is exclusive to the Platinum Plan.
How does the restoration of sum insured: If the Sum Insured gets reduced or exhausted due to a claim during the Policy Period, it is automatically restored to the extent of the claim amount, not exceeding the Restoration limit opted (50% or 100% of Sum Insured).
What expenses are included under air amb: Air ambulance coverage is available for life-threatening medical emergency conditions that require immediate and rapid ambulance transportation to a hospital/medical center when ground transportation cannot provide it, necessary medical treatment is unavailable at the insured person's location at the time of emergency, and it is prescribed by a Medical Practitioner and medically necessary. The provided clauses do not specify which plans are eligible.
Are there any exclusions related to self: Under the Personal Accident section, intentional self-injury, suicide or attempted suicide are excluded. Engagement in aviation or ballooning, speed contests or racing (other than on foot), bungee jumping, parasailing, parachuting, ski-diving, BASE jumping, paragliding, hang gliding, mountain or rock climbing necessitating the use of guides or ropes, solo climbing, ice climbing, ice canoeing, scuba diving, Caving, cave diving, potholing, abseiling, snowboarding, wave ski surfing, and deep sea diving using hard helmet and breathing apparatus are also excluded.
What percentage of coverage is provided: For accidental death, 100% of CSI (Covered Sum Insured) is payable. For loss of two entire limbs, or sight of two eyes, or one entire limb and sight of one eye, 100% of CSI is payable. For loss of one entire limb or sight of one eye, 50% of CSI is payable. For permanent total disablement, 100% of CSI is payable.
How is a chronic condition defined in th: A chronic condition is defined as a disease, illness, or injury that needs ongoing or long-term monitoring through consultations, examinations, check-ups, and/or tests; needs ongoing or long-term control or relief of symptoms; or requires rehabilitation for the patient or for the patient to be specially trained to cope with it. The clauses do not detail how this definition affects long-term coverage eligibility.
What are the financial and documentation: The Policy covers Medical Expert’s fees for a second opinion if the Insured Person is diagnosed with one of the specified major Illnesses. A claim under this clause is admissible subject to the hospitalization claim being admissible, and this expense is payable only once per Illness per Insured Person.
What constitutes a medically necessary t: Medically Necessary Treatment means any treatment, tests, medication, or stay in hospital or part of a stay in hospital which is prescribed by a Medical Practitioner, is medically necessary, and is for a life-threatening medical emergency requiring rapid ambulance transportation where ground transport is insufficient, or when necessary medical treatment is unavailable at the insured person's location. For it to be considered a medical necessity, it must be certified by the attending Medical Practitioner to remove a direct and immediate health risk to the insured.
Can policyholders migrate to another pol: Migration means the right accorded to health insurance policyholders (including all members under family cover and members of group health insurance policy) to transfer the credit gained for pre-existing conditions and time-bound exclusions with the same insurer.
What is the maximum age for entry and re: The maximum entry age for all members for all plans is 65 years. However, persons 70 years of age can also be covered under Silver or Gold Plans (but not Diamond and Platinum Plans), with co-payment applicable in all subsequent renewals. Change of Plan is not allowed for a policy covering any person above the age of 70 years.
Are expenses incurred at a hospital not: Expenses incurred towards treatment in any hospital or by any Medical Practitioner or any other provider specifically excluded by the Insurer are not admissible. However, in case of life threatening situations or following an accident, expenses up to the stage of stabilization are payable but not the complete claim.
How does the insurer define contribution: CONTRIBUTION is essentially the right of an insurer to call upon other insurers liable to the same insured to share the cost of an indemnity claim on a rate able proportion of Sum Insured. The contribution clause is not applicable if the cover/benefit offered is fixed in nature or does not have any relation to the treatment costs.
Does the policy cover outpatient telemed: Yes, telemedicine consultations are covered, subject to Limits/Sub limits prescribed in the Policy Schedule. The limit of amount payable for telemedicine is maximum Rs. 2,000/- per family, for a policy period.
What benefits are available for the trea: For treatment of dog bite (or bite of any other rabid animal like monkey, cat etc.), a maximum of Rs. 5,000/- actually incurred on immunization injections is covered in any one Policy Period. This will be part of Domiciliary Hospitalization limits, and Anti Rabies Vaccination is specifically provided for.
Are immunotherapy and oral chemotherapy: Oral chemotherapy is covered per policy period at 25% of SI, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000, or up to INR 1,50,000. Immunotherapy-Monoclonal Antibody (given as injection) is covered per policy period at 10% of SI, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000, or up to INR 1,50,000.
Does the policy offer geographical cover: Yes, the policy can be extended to cover Insured Persons visiting other SAARC countries (Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka) without additional premium, by making a written request before leaving the country. Cashless service is not available for treatment taken in countries outside India; such claims shall be considered only on re-imbursement basis.
Are policyholders allowed to change thei: Yes, if the family size increases on renewal, Sum Insured can be increased to maximum two slabs higher. If no claims are reported in the two immediate preceding Policy Periods, a change to the next Plan (e.g., Silver to Gold) at the initial SI slab or two steps higher from the current SI is allowed. Change of Plan is not allowed for a Policy covering any person above the age of 70 years.
Is there any penalty for non-disclosure: Coverage under the policy after 36 months for any pre-existing disease is subject to it being declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. The clauses do not explicitly mention a penalty for non-disclosure beyond the condition for coverage.
What types of room upgrades or hospital: Proportionate deductions in claim amounts may result if the Insured Person is admitted in a hospital room where the room category or the Room Rent incurred is higher than the eligibility specified in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.
Can personal accident coverage be added: Yes, Personal Accident Cover (Worldwide) is available. It covers accidental death (100% of CSI), loss of two entire limbs, sight of two eyes, or one entire limb and sight of one eye (100% of CSI), loss of one entire limb or sight of one eye (50% of CSI), and permanent total disablement (100% of CSI), resulting solely and directly from sudden, unforeseen, and involuntary events within 12 months.
Does the policy allow claims for both or: Yes, the policy covers in-patient Hospitalization Medical expenses for the organ donor when the Insured Person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to relevant acts and the recipient's claim is admissible. Separately, a lump sum payment of 10% of Sum Insured is payable to the Insured Person donating an organ, provided the donation conforms to relevant acts and the policy has been in force for at least 12 months for the donor.
What exclusions are applicable to HIV/AI: The Company shall indemnify the Hospital or the Insured the Medical Expenses for In-Patient Care, Pre and Post Hospitalization Expenses related to HIV infection. No specific exclusions applicable to HIV/AIDS-related treatment are listed in the provided clauses.
How are AYUSH (Ayurveda, Yoga, Unani, Si: The Company shall indemnify medical expenses incurred for inpatient care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homeopathy systems of medicines up to the limit of sum insured in any AYUSH Hospital. However, massages, steam bath, and other alternative or AYUSH treatments (other than Ayurveda and Homeopathy) are excluded.
Does the policy provide any automatic re: Yes, a grace period of 30 days is allowed in the event of delay in renewal of the Policy. No coverage is available during the grace period, and any disease/Injury contracted during this break period will not be covered and treated as Pre-existing disease. This grace period helps treat the renewal as continuous for gaining credit for pre-existing diseases and waiting periods.
How are claims handled when hospitalizat: If hospitalization happens outside the network hospital list, cashless access services are not available. In such cases, the Insured Person may obtain the treatment and later submit the full claim papers to the Company/TPA within 15 days of discharge from the Hospital for consideration.
What is the role of the TPA in the claim: The TPA issues the ID card to the Insured Person, which is used solely to avail Cashless facility in a Network Hospital. Upon policy cancellation or non-renewal, all ID cards must be immediately returned to the TPA at the insured’s expense.
Under what circumstances can the insurer: The Company / TPA reserves the right to deny pre-authorization in case the Hospital / Insured Person is unable to provide the relevant information/medical details as required by the Company/ TPA. In such circumstances denial of Cashless Access should in no way be construed as denial of liability.
What is the impact on claim admissibilit: If the Insured Person is admitted in a room where the room category or the Room Rent incurred is higher than the eligibility, then the Policyholder/ Insured Person shall bear a ratable proportion of the expenses. Proportionate deductions related to the room rent category can be waived by paying an additional premium.

If two or more policies are taken by the insured from one or more insurers, the contribution clause shall not be applicable where the cover/benefit offered is fixed in nature or does not have any relation to the treatment costs.

What is the role of the Third Party Admi: The TPA issues ID cards for cashless facility in network hospitals, preserves the confidentiality of documents and information for claims, and its authorized medical practitioners may examine the insured person. Policyholders should deliver written notices or communications to the TPA's address as shown in the Schedule.
What is the policyholder's recourse if t: If cashless access is denied, it should not be construed as a denial of liability, and the Insured Person may obtain treatment as per their doctor’s advice and later submit full claim papers for reimbursement.
Can a family floater policy claim be fil: For members subsequently added to a family floater policy, specific exclusions (4.A, 4.B, and 4.C) shall apply from the date of their inclusion in the Policy.
Is dental treatment covered if it is due: Dental treatment is covered if necessitated due to an Injury.
What are the exclusions related to war,: War, invasion, act of foreign enemy, hostilities (whether war be declared or not), civil war, rebellion, revolution, insurrection, mutiny, military or usurped power, seizure, capture, arrest, restraints and detainments of people are excluded. Additionally, losses caused by or arising from ionizing radiations or contamination by radioactivity from any nuclear fuel, nuclear weapon material, or from any nuclear waste from the combustion of nuclear fuel, or nuclear, chemical or biological attack or weapons are excluded.
Are fertility treatments, IVF, or surrog: Expenses related to sterility and infertility, including any type of contraception, sterilization, Assisted Reproduction services (such as artificial insemination and advanced reproductive technologies like IVF, ZIFT, GIFT, ICSI), and Gestation Surrogacy are excluded, unless it is for platinum plan up to the limits mentioned therein.
How are psychiatric evaluations treated: Medical expenses for mental illness (including Pre and Post Hospitalization Expenses) are covered if the illness is defined as mental illness, hospitalization occurs in a Mental Health Establishment, and is advised by a Mental Health Professional. However, mental conditions associated with alcohol/drug abuse, mental retardation, and psychological counseling/therapy not requiring hospitalization are excluded.
Are hearing aids or visual aids (e.g., s: Spectacles, contact lenses, and hearing aids are not reimbursable.
What is the impact of policy discontinua: Renewal within the grace period treats the policy as continuous for the purpose of gaining credit for pre-existing diseases, time-bound exclusions, and all waiting periods.
Can premiums be refunded if no claims ar: Yes, for annual policies, a proportionate premium for the unexpired policy period can be refunded, subject to no claim(s) having been made during the policy period.
What are the specific coverages for burn: Expenses for cosmetic or plastic surgery or any treatment to change appearance are excluded, unless for reconstruction following an accident burns(s) or Cancer.
Is accidental death or disability includ: Yes, accidental death and various forms of disability (loss of limbs, sight, or permanent total disablement) are included under the Personal Accident Cover if the injury is the sole and direct cause within 12 months of its occurrence.
What happens to claims in case of the po: For accidental death, the Company undertakes to pay 100% of CSI to the insured, his nominee, or legal heir, if the bodily injury results solely and directly from an unforeseen and involuntary event and causes death within 12 months of its occurrence.
Are there any waiting periods for claims: Expenses related to listed conditions, surgeries, or treatments are excluded until the expiry of the specified waiting period of continuous coverage after the policy's inception. There is also a 30-day waiting period for any illness from the first policy commencement date.
Are expenses for experimental or clinica: Unproven or experimental treatment, including drug experimental therapy not based on established medical practice in India, is not covered.
Is there a benefit payable on diagnosis: Yes, under the Life Hardship Survival Benefit Plan, a survival benefit is payable if the Insured Person is diagnosed with one of the 11 critical illnesses, and in-patient treatment is not mandatory for claiming this benefit.
Can coverage be enhanced mid-term, and h: A higher sum insured can be granted subsequently, and the waiting periods shall apply afresh to the enhanced sum insured.
Are outpatient surgeries conducted under: Yes, medical treatment and/or surgical procedures undertaken under General or Local Anesthesia in a hospital/day care centre in less than 24 hours are defined as Day Care Treatment. Related expenses such as Surgeon fees, Anesthesia fees, and Surgery Charges are reimbursable.
How is the daily room rent limit determi: The daily room rent limit is determined as per the entitled room category and Room Rent/ICU limit as specified in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.
Are specific diseases like tuberculosis,: Medical Expenses for In-Patient Care, Pre and Post Hospitalization Expenses related to HIV infection are covered. The clauses do not specify coverage for tuberculosis or Hepatitis, nor do they detail documentation requirements.
Are second opinions for major surgeries: Medical Second Opinions are reimbursable for specified major Illnesses, covering Medical Expert’s fees. This expense is payable only once per Illness per Insured Person, and the claim is admissible subject to the Hospitalization claim being admissible. The exact monetary limits for this benefit are not provided in the clauses.
What are the defined consequences of not: Coverage after 36 months for pre-existing diseases requires disclosure at application and acceptance by the insurer.
Are congenital anomalies\u2014internal a: External congenital anomalies are excluded; internal congenital anomalies are not explicitly addressed.
What are the benefits and eligibility co: The policy covers organ transplant claims admissible under the hospitalization section, excluding organ acquisition, donor screening, and donor medical expenses.
What is the coverage limit for telemedic: Telemedicine consultations are reimbursed up to Rs. 2,000 per family per policy period.
What are the limits and requirements for: Ambulance services are covered up to Rs. 1000 per illness or 1% of the sum insured per policy period (max Rs. 3000). Air ambulance is covered for life-threatening emergencies when ground transportation is insufficient and medically necessary.
How is daily hospital cash allowance str: Daily hospital cash allowance is payable for each completed 24-hour period of hospitalization, up to a maximum of 10 days per illness, with an overall policy limit of 1.5% of the sum insured.
Are mental illnesses and related conditi: Mental illnesses are covered under specific conditions (in a mental health establishment, advised by a mental health professional); however, those related to alcohol/drug abuse are excluded.
Are oral chemotherapy and monoclonal ant: Oral chemotherapy is reimbursed up to 25% of the sum insured or INR 1,50,000, whichever is less; monoclonal antibody treatment is also covered with a per-policy-period limit of 10% of the sum insured or INR 1,50,000.
How does the policy define medically nec: Medically necessary treatment includes treatment, tests, medication, or hospital stay that addresses a direct health risk, certified by the attending physician.
What is the procedure for pre-authorizat: Cashless pre-authorization turnaround time is one hour, and final bill authorization is within three hours of discharge authorization.
Under what circumstances is the cashless: Cashless facility may be withdrawn before patient discharge if the claim becomes inadmissible or requires further investigation.
How does the policy treat expenses for d: Diagnostic expenses not related to the current diagnosis and treatment are excluded.
Are AYUSH (Ayurveda, Yoga, Unani, Siddha: AYUSH treatments are covered up to the sum insured limit for inpatient care in an AYUSH hospital.
What is the refund policy on cancellatio: For annual policies with no claims, a proportionate premium refund is given for the unexpired period; for policies longer than one year, the unexpired period premium is refunded if risk coverage hasn't started.
Are treatments undertaken outside India: Treatment in India is covered.  There is mention that newborn baby coverage requires expenses to be incurred in hospitals or nursing homes in India as in-patients.
What benefits does the policy provide fo: If an insured person is diagnosed with one of eleven critical illnesses and a claim is admissible, a survival benefit is payable in addition to the sum insured, with no co-payment.
Is coverage available for day care proce: Day care procedures less than 24 hours are covered, with a list of procedures specified in Appendix I.
What is the impact on waiting periods wh: When the sum insured is enhanced, waiting periods apply afresh to the enhanced amount, with the longest waiting period applying if a disease/procedure has multiple waiting periods.
Is HIV/AIDS or related treatment covered: The policy indemnifies medical expenses for inpatient care, pre- and post-hospitalization related to HIV/AIDS infection.
What are the rules regarding medical sec: Medical second opinions are covered for specified major illnesses, with expenses reimbursed subject to the admissibility of the hospitalization claim; this is payable only once per illness.
Does the policy mandate in-patient treat: In-patient treatment is not mandatory for all benefits; there's an exception for at least one benefit.
Is bariatric (obesity-related) surgery c: Bariatric surgery is covered if it's medically advised, follows clinical protocols, the member is at least 18, and has a BMI of 40 or more, or 35 or more with severe comorbidities after less invasive methods fail.
What is the policy\u2019s stance on expe: Unproven/experimental treatments not based on established medical practice in India are not covered.
Does the policy cover prosthetics and im: Prosthetics and implants are not subject to room rent limits.
What are the exclusions related to inten: Intentional self-injury and attempted suicide are excluded.
How does the policy define and treat exp: Infertility treatment and ART are covered subject to specific conditions; it must be proven that natural conception is impossible due to sub-fertility/infertility.
Is treatment due to alcohol or drug addi: Treatment for alcohol or drug abuse or any addictive condition and consequences thereof are excluded, as are mental conditions associated with such abuse.
Are vision aids like spectacles or heari: The policy excludes the cost of spectacles and contact lenses.
Are pre- and post-hospitalization expens: Pre- and post-hospitalization expenses are covered for 30 days prior to and 60 days after hospitalization.
Does the policy provide for restoration: If the sum insured is exhausted due to a claim, it is automatically restored to the extent of the claim amount, but not exceeding the restoration limit opted at the time of policy purchase (50% or 100% of the sum insured).
What is the grace period allowed for pol: A 30-day grace period is allowed for policy renewal; however, no coverage is available during this period, and any illness or injury during this time will not be covered.
What exclusions apply specifically to co: Expenses for cosmetic or plastic surgery are excluded unless for reconstruction following an accident, burns, or cancer.
Are permanent total or partial disabilit: The policy covers permanent total or partial disabilities due to accidents.  Specific payouts depend on the type of disability, and the documentation needed is not specified.
What is the policy\u2019s position on ex: Dietary supplements and substances purchased without a prescription, including vitamins and minerals, are excluded unless prescribed by a medical practitioner.
Is surrogacy covered under the policy, a: Expenses related to sterility and infertility, including surrogacy, are excluded; however, this exclusion does not apply to the Platinum plan, up to the limits mentioned therein.
What is the process for claim rejection,: If a claim is rejected, the reason will be recorded in writing and communicated to the insured within 30 days of receiving all necessary documents.
What is covered under hospitalization ex: Hospitalization and Domiciliary Hospitalization are covered for medically necessary treatment of illnesses/diseases or injuries sustained by the Insured Person(s) during the policy period, up to the limit of Sum Insured or mentioned sublimits. This includes pre and post hospitalization expenses for mental illness under specific conditions related to diagnosis, establishment, and professional advice.
Does the policy cover day care procedure: Yes, day care procedures/surgeries are covered, allowing for a relaxation of the 24-hour minimum hospitalization duration if the treatment is undertaken under General or Local Anesthesia in a hospital/day care centre in less than 24 hours.
Is coverage provided for pre-existing di: Yes, coverage is provided for pre-existing diseases after a waiting period of 36 months, provided the condition was declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. The policy also allows for gaining credit for pre-existing diseases upon continuous renewal.
What is the waiting period for pre-exist: The waiting period for pre-existing diseases is 36 months, subject to the disease being declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. If any specified disease/procedure falls under its own waiting period, the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply.
Are diagnostic tests covered under this: Expenses primarily for diagnostics and evaluation purposes only are excluded. Additionally, any diagnostic expenses that are not related or incidental to the current diagnosis and treatment are excluded.
Are maternity expenses included?: Yes, maternity expenses are included under the Diamond and Platinum plans for in-patient medical expenses incurred for a delivery (including caesarean section) or lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the policy period. The company's maximum liability per delivery or termination is limited to 2.5% of the Sum Insured per policy period, and benefits are admissible only if incurred in Hospital/Nursing Homes as in-patients in India.
Does the plan cover newborn baby expense: Yes, the policy covers New Born Baby expenses from day one upon payment of the requisite premium. Medical expenses incurred for treatment taken in a Hospital as an in-patient are payable, subject to the policy's terms and conditions, and must be incurred in Hospital/Nursing Homes in India.
Is organ donor treatment covered?: The policy covers in-patient hospitalization medical expenses for the organ donor when the insured person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994. A lump sum payment of 10% of the Sum Insured is also payable to the insured person if they are the donor. However, the cost of organ acquisition, donor screening, and any pre and post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor are not covered.
Are AYUSH treatments (Ayurveda, Homeopat: Inpatient care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha, and Homeopathy systems of medicines are covered up to the limit of sum insured in any AYUSH Hospital. However, other alternative treatments like massages, steam baths, acupuncture, acupressure, and magneto-therapy are excluded.
Does the policy cover domiciliary hospit: Yes, customary charges for Domiciliary Hospitalization for medically necessary treatment of illnesses/diseases or injuries sustained during the policy period are covered up to the limit of Sum Insured or mentioned sublimits. However, liability under Domiciliary Hospitalization Benefit is restricted for certain listed diseases such as Epilepsy, Hypertension, Influenza, and others.
What treatments are explicitly excluded: The policy excludes expenses related to specified disease/procedure waiting periods, treatment arising from breach of law with criminal intent, treatment in specifically excluded hospitals/providers (except for stabilization in emergencies/accidents), treatment for alcoholic drug or substance abuse, treatments in health hydros/nature cure clinics/spas or for domestic reasons, and non-prescribed dietary supplements. Additionally, any illness treatment within 30 days from the first policy commencement is excluded, unless due to an accident or if the insured has continuous coverage for over twelve months.
Is cosmetic or plastic surgery excluded?: Cosmetic or plastic surgery and any treatment to change appearance are excluded unless they are for reconstruction following an accident, burns, or cancer.
Are dental treatments covered?: Dental treatment is generally not covered unless necessitated due to an injury. However, the policy makes an exception for Out Patient Department (OPD) benefit for Dental cover in the Platinum Plan.
Are obesity or weight control treatments: Surgical treatment for obesity is covered only if it fulfills all specified conditions, including being advised by a doctor, supported by clinical protocols, for individuals 18 years or older, and meeting specific Body Mass Index (BMI) criteria (greater than or equal to 40, or greater than or equal to 35 in conjunction with specific severe co-morbidities) after less invasive methods have failed.
Does the policy exclude injuries from al: Yes, treatment for alcoholic drug or substance abuse or any addictive condition and consequences thereof is explicitly excluded.
Are diseases diagnosed within the first: Yes, expenses related to the treatment of any illness diagnosed within 30 days from the first policy commencement date are excluded, except for claims arising due to an accident. This exclusion does not apply if the Insured Person has continuous coverage for more than twelve months.
Is cancer treatment like chemotherapy or: Chemotherapy expenses are covered under domiciliary hospitalization benefits. There is no explicit mention of radiotherapy in the provided clauses.
Are ICU and ventilator charges covered?: Yes, ICU charges are covered and include expenses for the ICU bed, general medical support services, monitoring devices, critical care nursing, and intensivist charges. The policy also mentions "Room Rent/ICU limit" in relation to proportionate deductions.
Are ambulance charges reimbursed?: Yes, ambulance service charges are covered up to specified maximum limits per illness (e.g., Rs.1000 or Rs.2000) and per policy period (1% of Sum Insured, subject to maximum Rs.3000 or Rs.6000).
Is coverage provided for mental illness: Yes, mental illness coverage is provided for medical expenses, including pre and post hospitalization expenses, under specific conditions. These conditions require the illness to be covered under the definition of mental illness, hospitalization in a Mental Health Establishment, and hospitalization advised by a Mental Health Professional.
What is the room rent limit under this p: Room rent is covered as per the entitled room category based on the Room Rent/ICU limit specified in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance. If the incurred room rent is higher than eligibility, a proportionate deduction will apply.
Are there any sub-limits on specific tre: Yes, hospitalization expenses are covered up to the limit of Sum Insured or mentioned sublimits, which are detailed within the policy.
Is cashless hospitalization available?: Yes, cashless hospitalization is available for treatments within India, with specified turn-around times for pre-authorization and final bill authorization. Cashless service is not available for treatment taken outside India.
Are maternity benefits available for bot: Yes, maternity benefits are available for both natural childbirth and cesarean deliveries, and also for lawful medical termination of pregnancy. This benefit is specifically applicable to Diamond and Platinum Plans.
Is the policy renewable for a lifetime?: The policy shall ordinarily be renewable except on grounds of fraud, misrepresentation, non-disclosure by the insured, or if the product is withdrawn. If the product is withdrawn, suitable options to migrate to other similar health insurance products/plans will be provided. There is no explicit statement that the policy is renewable for a lifetime, but it states it 'shall be renewable' under conditions.
Can I port this health insurance policy: Yes, portability is a facility provided to policyholders, including all family members under family cover, to transfer credits gained for Pre-Existing Diseases and Specific Waiting Periods from one insurer to another.
Will my premium increase after making a: The clauses do not state that your premium will increase after making a claim. However, the Cumulative Bonus (CB) accrued will be reduced at the same rate it has accrued if a claim is made in any particular year.
What is the maximum sum insured?: The maximum sum insured, which is the Company's maximum liability per policy period for all claims, is the Sum Insured (Individual or Floater) opted and Cumulative Bonus (if any) specified in the Policy Schedule. Specific benefits like Maternity Expenses and Domiciliary Hospitalization Benefits have sub-limits, and the Sum Insured can be increased at renewal.
How do I file a reimbursement claim?: To file a reimbursement claim, you must notify the Company/TPA within 24 hours from emergency hospitalization or before discharge (whichever is earlier), or at least 48 hours prior for planned hospitalization. Then, submit the following documents within the prescribed time limit: a duly completed claim form, photo identity proof of the patient, medical practitioner’s prescription advising admission, original bills with itemized break-up, payment receipts, and a discharge summary. Reimbursement for hospitalization expenses must be submitted within thirty days of discharge, and for post-hospitalization expenses, within fifteen days from completion of treatment.
Can I add my parents to this health insu: Yes, parents and parents-in-law are included in the definition of 'Family' that can be covered under the policy, along with the proposer, legally wedded spouse, and dependent children.
What is the specific waiting period for: The provided clauses state that 'Portability' allows policyholders to transfer credits gained for Pre-Existing Diseases and Specific Waiting Periods from one insurer to another. 'Renewal' includes a grace period for treating the renewal as continuous, which allows for gaining credit for pre-existing diseases, time-bound exclusions, and all waiting periods. However, the specific duration of the waiting period for pre-existing diseases is not mentioned in these clauses.
How does the proportionate deduction cla: If an insured person is admitted to a room with rates exceeding the specified limits, the reimbursement or payment for 'Associated Medical Expenses' incurred at the hospital will be proportionately reduced. This deduction is calculated based on the ratio of the admissible room rate per day to the actual room rent per day. Proportionate deduction does not apply if the insured is admitted to ICU/ICCU. Associated Medical Expenses, for this purpose, exclude the cost of pharmacy and consumables, implants and medical devices, and diagnostics.
What are the pre-authorization and docum: Treatment at a non-network provider is subject to pre-authorization by the Company or its authorized TPA. To obtain this authorization, a cashless request form available with the TPA should be completed and sent to the Company/TPA along with related medical information. The Company/TPA will then issue a pre-authorization letter after verification. For reimbursement, a claim notice with full particulars must be sent to the Company/TPA within 24 hours from the date of emergency hospitalization or before discharge, whichever is earlier.
What coverage is provided for robotic su: Coverage for robotic surgery is limited to the robotic component only. For immunotherapy, coverage is limited to the cost of injections only.
What are the monetary caps and waiting p: The clauses mention that expenses for treatment of cataract are subject to sub-limits, but do not specify the monetary caps. There is no information regarding joint replacement procedures or specific waiting periods for either procedure.
What is the claim submission deadline fo: The claim submission deadline for reimbursement of post-hospitalization expenses is within fifteen days from the completion of post-hospitalization treatment. The provided clauses do not specify the consequences of missing this deadline.
What is the procedure and timeline for n: In case of emergency hospitalization, a claim notice with full particulars must be sent to the Company/TPA (if applicable) within 24 hours from the date emergency hospitalization was required or before the Insured Person's discharge from the Hospital, whichever is earlier.
How are room rent sub-limits defined, an: Room rent sub-limits are defined as up to 2% of the sum insured, subject to a maximum of Rs. 5,000/- per day. If the actual room rent exceeds these limits, the reimbursement or payment of 'Associated Medical Expenses' (excluding cost of pharmacy and consumables, implants and medical devices, and diagnostics) will be proportionately reduced based on the ratio of the admissible rate to the actual rate per day. This proportionate deduction does not apply if the insured is admitted to ICU/ICCU.
Is treatment at AYUSH hospitals covered,: Yes, Medical Expenses incurred for Inpatient Care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Sidha, and Homeopathy systems of medicines are covered up to the limit of the sum insured in any AYUSH Hospital. For admissibility, an AYUSH Hospital must have at least 5 in-patient beds, a qualified AYUSH Medical Practitioner in charge round the clock, dedicated AYUSH therapy sections as required, and maintain daily records of patients accessible to the insurance company’s authorized representative.
What reimbursement documentation is need: For reimbursement of pre-hospitalization expenses, the claim must be supported with a duly completed claim form, photo identity proof of the patient, medical practitioner’s prescription advising admission, original bills with itemized break-up, payment receipts, and discharge summary including complete medical history of the patient along with other details. These documents must be submitted within the prescribed time limit.
What is the insurer\u2019s responsibilit: If a claim requires investigation, the Company must complete it within 30 days from the receipt of the last necessary document and settle or reject the claim within 45 days. In case of delay beyond 45 days, the Company is liable to pay interest to the policyholder at a rate 2% above the bank rate from the date of receipt of the last necessary document until the claim payment date.
What facilities or benefits are provided: The TPA's services include servicing of claims, specifically claim admissions and assessments, through pre-authorization of cashless treatment or processing of non-cashless claims, or both, according to policy terms. However, the services offered by a TPA explicitly do not include claim settlement and claim rejection.
Are diagnostic expenses reimbursed if th: Diagnostic expenses that are not related or not incidental to the current diagnosis and treatment are excluded from reimbursement. Expenses related to any admission primarily for diagnostics and evaluation purposes only are also excluded.
How is co-payment calculated for claims: Each claim is subject to a 5% co-payment for insured persons aged 75 years or less on policy inception, and a 15% co-payment for insured persons aged greater than 75 years on policy inception. An optional 20% co-payment on each admissible claim is available with a 25% discount in total premium.
Are infertility and assisted reproductio: Expenses related to sterility and infertility, including any type of sterilization, assisted reproduction services (such as artificial insemination, IVF, ZIFT, GIFT, ICSI), gestational surrogacy, and reversal of sterilization, are excluded from coverage.
What specific exclusions apply to intent: Treatment for intentional self-inflicted injury and attempted suicide is excluded. Additionally, treatment for alcoholism, drug or substance abuse, or any addictive condition and their consequences is excluded.
How does the policy treat treatment take: Treatment taken outside the geographical limits of India is excluded.
Are organ transplant-related expenses co: The policy indemnifies medical expenses for an organ donor's hospitalization for harvesting an organ donated to an insured person, provided the donation complies with the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994, the organ is for an insured person medically advised to undergo a transplant, and expenses are incurred for the donor as an in-patient in a hospital. Exclusions for organ donor expenses include pre-hospitalization and post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor, costs related to organ acquisition, experimental or investigational organ transplants, medical treatment or complications for the donor consequent to harvesting, and expenses for organ transportation or preservation. Documentation requirements for claims are not specified in the provided clauses.
What is the coverage limit and definitio: The policy provides a Hospital Cash benefit as a daily allowance up to the limit specified in the Table of Benefits for a maximum of five days, provided the hospitalization exceeds three days.
Under what conditions is bariatric surge: Bariatric surgery (though not explicitly named as such, the description matches) is reimbursed under the conditions that the surgery is advised by a doctor, supported by clinical protocols, the member is 18 years of age or older, and their Body Mass Index (BMI) is either greater than or equal to 40, or greater than or equal to 35 in conjunction with severe co-morbidities like obesity-related cardiomyopathy, following the failure of less invasive weight loss methods.
Does the policy cover OPD consultations: Out-patient Treatment is covered and includes out-patient consultations by a medical practitioner, diagnostic tests prescribed by a medical practitioner, medicines/drugs prescribed by a medical practitioner, and out-patient dental treatment. The limits of cover available for Out-patient Treatment range from INR 2,000 to INR 25,000, in addition to the sum insured opted. There is no mention of telemedicine services.
Is there a clause for automatic reinstat: The clauses indicate that a 'Reinstatement of Sum Insured due to Road Traffic Accident' is a provision, and for such a claim, a police investigation report confirming the road traffic accident is required. However, the clauses do not detail the process for automatic reinstatement or specific triggers beyond the need for a police report for such a claim.
What constitutes a critical illness clai: The benefit amount for Critical Illness cover is limited to 50% of the sum insured, with individual benefit amounts ranging from INR 2,00,000 to INR 25,00,000. Pre-policy checkup reports are required for individuals aged between eighteen and sixty-five years opting for Critical Illness cover. Exclusions apply if the critical illness or its symptoms were present before the first policy's inception or manifest within ninety days. The clauses do not define what constitutes a critical illness claim or specify documentation for survival benefits.
Are dental surgeries covered under these: Dental treatment is covered only if necessitated by an injury; otherwise, it is excluded. Cosmetic dental treatment, including procedures to straighten, lighten, reshape, and repair teeth (e.g., veneers, crowns, bridges, tooth-coloured fillings, implants, and tooth whitening), is explicitly excluded. Cosmetic or plastic surgery, generally excluded, may be covered if for reconstruction following an accident, burn(s), or cancer, or as part of medically necessary treatment to remove a direct and immediate health risk, provided it is certified by the attending Medical Practitioner.
What happens if a policyholder fails to: Policyholders are required to send notice with full particulars to the Company/TPA within 24 hours from the date of emergency hospitalization or before the Insured Person’s discharge from Hospital, whichever is earlier. The clauses do not specify what happens if this notification requirement is not met.
